org.kepler.provenance.sql

Class SQLRecording

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.provenance.Recording
      • org.kepler.provenance.sql.SQLRecording
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SQLRecordingV7

    public class SQLRecording
extends Recording
    SQL Implementation of Recording using SDM SPA schema.
    Author:
    Daniel Crawl

    • Method Detail

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws RecordingException
        Stop recording. Called when the Recording type changes or ProvenanceListener removed from canvas. NOTE: this is NOT called when the GUI exits or when the workflow runs from the command line. This is the last method called to a Recording instance.
        Overrides:
        disconnect in class Recording
        Throws:
        RecordingException

      • regActor

        public boolean regActor(Actor actor)
                 throws RecordingException

        Overrides:
        regActor in class Recording
        Returns:
        if true, register contents of actor.
        Throws:

      • regParameter

        public boolean regParameter(NamedObj parameter)
                     throws RecordingException
        Register a parameter. A parameter can be any entity stored in the MoML that does not have its own regNNN() method. This can be user-level parameters (e.g., Parameter, StringParameter, etc.) or internal to Kepler (e.g., _location, semanticType000, etc.). (A "parameter" corresponds to a property in the MoML).
        Overrides:
        regParameter in class Recording
        Returns:
        if true, register contents of parameter.
        Throws:
        RecordingException

                       NamedObj endPoint2)
                throws RecordingException
        Register a link between two endpoints.
        Overrides:
        regLink in class Recording
        Parameters:
        endPoint1 - first endpoint.
        endPoint2 - second endpoint.
        Returns:
        if true, register contents of link.

      • _checkConnection

        protected void _checkConnection(boolean allowReconnectWF)
                         throws RecordingException
        This method opens the database connection if necessary.
        Parameters:
        allowReconnectWF - - default true, only false if you want to force no _reconnectWF, e.g for non-write events like delete
        Throws:
        RecordingException

      • _getContainerId

        protected int _getContainerId(Nameable namedObj)
                       throws RecordingException
        Find the container id of an entity. If entity has no container, i.e., is the top-level object, returns 0. Otherwise if the container could not be found, returns RegEntity.UNKNOWN_ID.
        Throws:
        RecordingException
